intro: Speculantha borealis, commonly known as the northern speculantha, is a flowering plant native to the cold regions of the northern hemisphere. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open woodland or meadow habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are upright and often branched. Speculantha borealis is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
